title: Are the following sentences grammatically correct, 'Someone reported the missing child having been seen near the gas station' and, 'I don't remember my sister having been bitten by a dog'? - Quora

response.answer_text: They are both probably grammatical allowable, but the first one in particular is wordy and awkward: Someone reported seeing the missing child near the gas station. is much more likely. (The way you wrote it allows for the possibility that the person reporting is not the person seeing. But even then, it seems too convoluted.)
Both sentences need improvement: SOMEONE REPORTED THAT THE MISSING CHILD WAS SEEN NEAR THE GAS STATION. I DON’T REMEMBER MY SISTER BEING BITTEN BY A DOG.
Someone reported that the missing child was seen near the gas station. I don't remember my sister being bitten by a dog.
